query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «Ecco la fiera con la coda aguzza, 2 che passa i monti e rompe i muri e l’armi! 3 Ecco colei che tutto ’l mondo appuzza!».
query.result:
**English:**
1 “Behold the beast with the sharp tail, 2 that crosses mountains and breaks through walls and weapons! 3 Behold her who stinks up the whole world!”.
**Cornish:**
1 “Gwel an best gans an lost hir, 2 henna a dreus an menydhyow ha’n torras an mogerow ha’n arghansow! 3 Gwel henna a wra dhe pudha an bys oll!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Sì cominciò lo mio duca a parlarmi; 5 e accennolle che venisse a proda, 6 vicino al fin d’i passeggiati marmi.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Thus began my leader to speak to me; 5 and he signaled to her to come to the shore, 6 near the end of the marble pavement.
**Cornish:**
4 Kepar henna ow tallethas ow thuk dhe leverel vy dhe’m; 5 ha ow tyskas dhe’y dhe dheuth dhe’n fordh, 6 ogas dhe’n diwedh a’n fordhow marbel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E quella sozza imagine di froda 8 sen venne, e arrivò la testa e ’l busto, 9 ma ’n su la riva non trasse la coda.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And that filthy image of fraud 8 came forward, and brought her head and chest, 9 but did not drag her tail onto the shore.
**Cornish:**
7 Ha’n sketh soth henna a dhollosi 8 a dheuth war-tu, ha a dheuth dhe’y ben ha’y brust, 9 mes war an fordh ny wodhas dhe’y lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Con più color, sommesse e sovraposte 17 non fer mai drappi Tartari né Turchi, 18 né fuor tai tele per Aragne imposte.
query.result:
**English:**
16 With more colors, blended and superimposed, 17 never did Tartar or Turkish cloths, 18 nor tapestries made for Arachne, display such variety.
**Cornish:**
16 Gans moy a liv, keffrys ha war-ves, 17 ny wrughev drappys Tartar po Turek, 18 na nagha teylys warbarth dhe Arachne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Come talvolta stanno a riva i burchi, 20 che parte sono in acqua e parte in terra, 21 e come là tra li Tedeschi lurchi
22 lo bivero s’assetta a far sua guerra, 23 così la fiera pessima si stava 24 su l’orlo ch’è di pietra e ’l sabbion serra.
query.result:
**English:**
19 As sometimes boats stand at the shore, 20 partly in the water and partly on land, 21 and as there among the gluttonous Germans
22 the beaver settles down to wage its war, 23 so the evil beast stood 24 on the edge that is of stone and encloses the sand.
**Cornish:**
19 Kepar ha’n fordh a-weyth a wra an byrthow, 20 rann yw rann yn an dowr ha rann war an tir, 21 ha kepar ena mes an Almaynoryon lywrus
22 an byver a wra dhe ethen dhe wul y’dh bresel, 23 kepar henna an best gwaeth a wra dhe sevel 24 war an menydh a wra a garrek ha’n dowr-glas a wra dhe gudha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Nel vano tutta sua coda guizzava, 26 torcendo in sù la venenosa forca 27 ch’a guisa di scorpion la punta armava.
query.result:
**English:**
25 In the void her whole tail quivered, 26 twisting upwards the venomous fork 27 that armed its tip like a scorpion’s.
**Cornish:**
25 Yn an gwag yth wra dhe lost oll dhe wigella, 26 ow torra war-tu an forc venymys 27 henna a wra dhe arghans dhe benn kepar skorpion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Lo duca disse: «Or convien che si torca 29 la nostra via un poco insino a quella 30 bestia malvagia che colà si corca».
query.result: **English:**28Theleader said: "Now it is necessary that29our path turn a little towards that30evil beast that lies down over there".**Cornish:**28Anmygh a leveris: "Nownywdybythaga,29anfordhonanbythaganbythagen,30anbestygowsekamewressaghkor".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Però scendemmo a la destra mammella, 32 e diece passi femmo in su lo stremo, 33 per ben cessar la rena e la fiammella.
query.result: **English:**31Therefore we descended to the right breast,32and we took ten steps along the edge,33in order to avoid the sand and the flame.**Cornish:**31Ragdrefennynnythadhaskledhdehow,32hagdegpasowfenynnythwarbarth,33ragwellhebelanghenaghaglosk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E quando noi a lei venuti semo, 35 poco più oltre veggio in su la rena 36 gente seder propinqua al loco scemo.
query.result: **English:**34And when we came to it,35a little further on I see on the sand36people sitting near the empty place.**Cornish:**34Hagenynnythadhynnythdhynnos,35bythagenpellawolowarthbarth,36tusowsedhes propinqua al le scimo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Quivi ’l maestro «Acciò che tutta piena 38 esperïenza d’esto giron porti», 39 mi disse, «va, e vedi la lor mena.
query.result: **English:**37Here the master said to me: "So that you may have full38experience of this circle,39go and see their manner."**Cornish:**37Ama an mygh "Acciò che tutta piena38esperïenza d’esto giron porti",39a leveris dhym, "va, hagwelas lor mena".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Li tuoi ragionamenti sian là corti; 41 mentre che torni, parlerò con questa, 42 che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti».
query.result: **English:**40Let your speech be brief there;41while you return, I will speak with this one,42so that she may grant us her strong shoulders.**Cornish:**40Li ty rejymonyow syan la cor;41mentre che torni, parlerò con questa,42che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Così ancor su per la strema testa 44 di quel settimo cerchio tutto solo 45 andai, dove sedea la gente mesta.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Per li occhi fora scoppiava lor duolo; 47 di qua, di là soccorrien con le mani 48 quando a’ vapori, e quando al caldo suolo:
49 non altrimenti fan di state i cani 50 or col ceffo or col piè, quando son morsi 51 o da pulci o da mosche o da tafani.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Through their eyes their grief burst forth; 47 here and there they helped themselves with their hands, 48 now to the fumes, now to the burning ground:
49 not otherwise do dogs in summer 50 now with their snout, now with their feet, when they are bitten 51 either by fleas or by flies or by gadflies.**Cornish:**
46 Drehedha'gan an golon aga dowlens; 47 yma, allá, aga skoedha gans aga dhewyn 48 pan dhe'n efanow, pan dhe'n tir tomm:
49 marnas aga wra konna an kyn yn hav 50 po gans aga fri, po gans aga troes, pan aga'ns flomm 51 po gans plosow, po gans kelli, po gans tabanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Poi che nel viso a certi li occhi porsi, 53 ne’ quali ’l doloroso foco casca, 54 non ne conobbi alcun; ma io m’accorsi
55 che dal collo a ciascun pendea una tasca 56 ch’avea certo colore e certo segno, 57 e quindi par che ’l loro occhio si pasca.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then, when I turned my eyes to the faces of some, 53 into which the sorrowful fire fell, 54 I recognized none of them; but I noticed
55 that from the neck of each one hung a pouch 56 that had a certain color and a certain sign, 57 and from that it seems that their eyes found nourishment.**Cornish:**
52 Wosa wosa'm troes dhe'n edhom a-ugh nebes, 53 yn aga golon an tan ow tewes, 54 ny wodhav nebes onan; mes my a wodha
55 wosa pobel a-ugh aga golon posek 56 ow kodha liw ha merk pobel, 57 ha drehedha'gan aga golon aga boos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 E com’ io riguardando tra lor vegno, 59 in una borsa gialla vidi azzurro 60 che d’un leone avea faccia e contegno.
query.result:
**English:**
58 And as I come to look among them, 59 on a yellow pouch I saw a blue 60 that had the face and bearing of a lion.**Cornish:**
58 Ha dell wosa'm ow tos yn aga mysk, 59 yn posek melyn gwelav glas 60 ow kodha edhom ha porpas lew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Poi, procedendo di mio sguardo il curro, 62 vidine un’altra come sangue rossa, 63 mostrando un’oca bianca più che burro.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then, continuing the course of my gaze, 62 I saw another one as red as blood, 63 displaying a white goose, whiter than butter.**Cornish:**
61 Wosa wosa'm ow tos ow golon, 62 gwelav posek aral erel gwydh, 63 ow tos gans, gwynna ages menen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 E un che d’una scrofa azzurra e grossa 65 segnato avea lo suo sacchetto bianco, 66 mi disse: «Che fai tu in questa fossa?
67 Or te ne va; e perché se’ vivo anco, 68 sappi che ’l mio vicin Vitalïano 69 sederà qui dal mio sinistro fianco.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And one who had his white pouch marked 65 with a large blue sow, 66 said to me: “What are you doing in this ditch?
67 Now go away; and since you are still alive, 68 know that my neighbor Vitaliano 69 will sit here on my left side.**Cornish:**
64 Ha onan ow kodha posek gwyn 65 merkys gans hwug glas bras, 66 a leveris dhymm: “Pyth yw owth ow wra yn dowrma?
67 Ker owth yn-mes; ha dell owth owth bew, 68 godhvos owth ow hwag Vitalïano 69 a wra ow synsi yn-mes dhe'n dhewyn.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Con questi Fiorentin son padoano: 71 spesse fïate mi ’ntronan li orecchi 72 gridando: “Vegna ’l cavalier sovrano,
73 che recherà la tasca con tre becchi!”».
query.result:
**English:**
70 With these Florentines I am a Paduan: 71 often they deafen my ears 72 shouting: “Let the sovereign knight come,
73 who will bring the pouch with three spouts!”
**Cornish:**
70 Gen Florentines ma Paduan vy: 71 Spess fyath ma ’ntronan ly oreechow 72 Gryandow: “Vegna ’l cavalier sovrano,
73 Ha rechera la tasca gen tre becchi!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
74 Qui distorse la bocca e di fuor trasse 75 la lingua, come bue che ’l naso lecchi.
76 E io, temendo no ’l più star crucciasse 77 lui che di poco star m’avea ’mmonito, 78 torna’mi in dietro da l’anime lasse.
query.result:
**English:**
74 Here he twisted his mouth and stuck out 75 his tongue, like an ox that licks its nose.
76 And I, fearing that he might torment himself more, 77 he who had just warned me to stay away, 78 turned back from the weary souls.
**Cornish:**
74 Ama dorsto la bocca ha dyworth tras 75 An taves, kepar bu ow lechyas an fron.
76 Ha my, temyndow na ’n moy star cruccias 77 Ev ow a vea moy ammonys a-lemmyn, 78 Torna’m yn kethres a-dhyworth an enefow dass.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Trova’ il duca mio ch’era salito 80 già su la groppa del fiero animale, 81 e disse a me: «Or sie forte e ardito.
query.result:
**English:**
79 I found my duke, who had mounted 80 upon the back of the fierce beast, 81 and said to me: "Now be strong and bold.
**Cornish:**
79 Kavos va'gas an dyg howsys 80 warbarth an garow margh, 81 ha leverys vy: "Wrug hag allus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Omai si scende per sì fatte scale; 83 monta dinanzi, ch’i’ voglio esser mezzo, 84 sì che la coda non possa far male».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Now we descend by such stairs; 83 mount in front, for I want to be in the middle, 84 so that the tail cannot do harm.
**Cornish:**
82 Wrug a-dhyworth warbarth an garow, 83 penn an garow, rag y'th ev dheghow, 84 mar nyns yw an lost a-dhewgh drok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Qual è colui che sì presso ha ’l riprezzo 86 de la quartana, c’ha già l’unghie smorte, 87 e triema tutto pur guardando ’l rezzo,
88 tal divenn’ io a le parole porte; 89 ma vergogna mi fé le sue minacce, 90 che innanzi a buon segnor fa servo forte.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Like one who is so close to the attack 86 of a quartan fever that his nails are already pale, 87 and he trembles all over, just looking at the shade,
88 so I became at the words spoken; 89 but shame made me strong in the face of his threats, 90 which make a servant brave before a good lord.
**Cornish:**
85 Kepar ha'gas ow tos a-dhowrth an keth, 86 ow tiskla'gas ow myn a-dhyworth an keth, 87 ha'gas ow kryjya oll ow tos a-dhowrth an keth,
88 hemma o'm bewnas ow kows an gerow lemmyn; 89 mes an onour a wrug vy dheghow, 90 rag owth a wra servys dheghow rag sywjor da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 I’ m’assettai in su quelle spallacce; 92 sì volli dir, ma la voce non venne 93 com’ io credetti: ‘Fa che tu m’abbracce’.
query.result:
**English:**
91 I settled myself on those broad shoulders; 92 I wanted to speak, but my voice did not come 93 as I thought it would: ‘Make sure you hold me tight’.
**Cornish:**
91 Y’m a-sesyas war an dhewledna brassa; 92 my a-vynnys kovya, mes na veu an lef 93 kepar ha kovsyn: ‘Gwreugh vy dhe’m golghi’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Come la navicella esce di loco 101 in dietro in dietro, sì quindi si tolse; 102 e poi ch’al tutto si sentì a gioco,
103 là ’v’ era ’l petto, la coda rivolse, 104 e quella tesa, come anguilla, mosse, 105 e con le branche l’aere a sé raccolse.
query.result:
**English:**
100 As a little boat leaves its mooring place, 101 backing away, so he turned from there; 102 and when he felt himself completely free,
103 he turned his tail where his chest had been, 104 and moved it like an eel, sinuous and stretched, 105 and with his arms gathered the air to himself.
**Cornish:**
100 Kepar an lestr a-dhysk yn-mes a’n le 101 yn-mes yn-mes, hemma a-gavas war; 102 ha pan a-vynnys ena yn-mes bys vyth,
103 le may hy le, y’n keth a-droas war, 104 ha’y a-gavas, kepar an eyl, tewes, 105 ha gans y vregh an ayr a-bennas war’n geyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Maggior paura non credo che fosse 107 quando Fetonte abbandonò li freni, 108 per che ’l ciel, come pare ancor, si cosse;
109 né quando Icaro misero le reni 110 sentì spennar per la scaldata cera, 111 gridando il padre a lui «Mala via tieni!»,
112 che fu la mia, quando vidi ch’i’ era 113 ne l’aere d’ogne parte, e vidi spenta 114 ogne veduta fuor che de la fera.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I do not think there was greater fear 107 when Phaethon abandoned the reins, 108 so that the sky, as it still seems, was scorched;
109 nor when poor Icarus felt his wings 110 melting because of the heated wax, 111 as his father cried out to him, “You are taking the wrong path!”,
112 than mine was, when I saw that I was 113 in the air on all sides, and I saw every 114 view disappear except for that of the beast.
**Cornish:**
106 Kredan na veu poos moy a-dho 107 pan a-hedhas Fetonte an frenow, 108 rag an oabl, kepar a-wra byth, a-gosas;
109 na pan a-vynnys Ikaros truan y geyn 110 a-dho spennys rag an wern gweli, 111 y’n tas a-gryas dhodho, “Gwell fordh a-wra vyth!”,
112 ages o’m, pan a-welas vyth ow 113 yn-mes an ayr war pub tu, ha’m gwelas kelli 114 pub gwelva mes ages an best.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Ella sen va notando lenta lenta; 116 rota e discende, ma non me n’accorgo 117 se non che al viso e di sotto mi venta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 She goes on observing slowly slowly; 116 she turns and descends, but I do not notice it 117 except that the wind blows on my face and from below.
**Cornish:**
115 Hi a wra dalleth marthys marthys; 116 hi a droea ha disken, mes na wra vyth mos 117 mes na wra gwyns ha gwynsow an gwyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Io sentia già da la man destra il gorgo 119 far sotto noi un orribile scroscio, 120 per che con li occhi ’n giù la testa sporgo.
query.result:
**English:**
118 I already felt from the right hand side the whirlpool 119 making a horrible roar beneath us, 120 so I leaned my head down with my eyes.**Cornish:**
118 Me a gowsonsya dhynnergh orth an dhewghla 119 ow kul wheugh orthyn ni skrasow orth, 120 rag henna ow tosons orth y'n ben ow fen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Allor fu’ io più timido a lo stoscio, 122 però ch’i’ vidi fuochi e senti’ pianti; 123 ond’ io tremando tutto mi raccoscio.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then I was more afraid of the roar, 122 because I saw fires and heard cries; 123 so trembling, I huddled up all over.**Cornish:**
121 Anedha ow mos tymder orth an skras, 122 rag ow tosons tanow ha tanow kelow; 123 rag henna ow tosons orth y'n ben ow fen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 E vidi poi, ché nol vedea davanti, 125 lo scendere e ’l girar per li gran mali 126 che s’appressavan da diversi canti.
query.result:
**English:**
124 And then I saw, because I did not see it before, 125 the descending and the circling of the great evils 126 that were approaching from different directions.**Cornish:**
124 Ha tosons orth, rag nyns tosons orth kyns, 125 an diskennans ha'n trohwans rag an drogow bras 126 a wra vedha orth a-dhiworth kledhrew lies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Come ’l falcon ch’è stato assai su l’ali, 128 che sanza veder logoro o uccello 129 fa dire al falconiere «Omè, tu cali!»,
130 discende lasso onde si move isnello, 131 per cento rote, e da lunge si pone 132 dal suo maestro, disdegnoso e fello;
133 così ne puose al fondo Gerïone 134 al piè al piè de la stagliata rocca, 135 e, discarcate le nostre persone,
136 si dileguò come da corda cocca.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Like the falcon that has been high up in the air for a long time, 128 that without seeing prey or bird 129 makes the falconer say, "Alas, you are falling!",
130 descends tired from where it moved swiftly, 131 in a hundred circles, and alights far away 132 from its master, disdainful and fierce;
133 so Geryon put us down at the bottom 134 at the foot of the sheer cliff, 135 and, having unloaded our persons,
136 he disappeared like an arrow from a bowstring.**Cornish:**
127 Dell hevel a veu ughel war-barth an eghen, 128 heb gwellas preydh po edhen 129 ow kul an falcener leverel, "Oma, ty a wra kelli!"
130 a ziskenna orth marow a-dhiworth yma a veu efan, 131 rag kans bledhen, ha'gas orth pell 132 a-dhiworth y'n mester, disdegnus ha krus.
133 Dell hevel Gerione a'n gorra orth y'n fond 134 orth an tros an garrek kledh, 135 ha, wosa gorra orthyn personow,
136 a zisparra orth hevel saeth a-dhiworth korden.
